Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, Calvin Koepke focuses on Genesis theme performance, Chris Coyier to attend Profitable WordPress Developer Bootcamp, and we hit the 💯th edition milestone.

Themes

Imagely launch their latest Genesis photography theme, Limitless.

And, as you’d expect, Limitless is another clean, attractive theme from the company that has already produced over a dozen WordPress Genesis photography themes as well as the NextGEN Gallery plugin.

Don't miss this! Introducing Limitless, Our Latest Photography Theme https://t.co/Bntj8jy5LS pic.twitter.com/ebzCfuXKGM

— Imagely (@imagely) May 18, 2017

Calvin Koepke has updated the theme used on his website to focus on performance, he explains:

With this theme, I wanted to reign in the excessive default resources that are usually coupled with modern themes and trim everything down to as small as possible. The result?

An average ~24kb page size on my homepage, and ~500ms load time. Pretty great results for what many will call a “slow” platform!

To read more about his approach to building the theme – and his use of CSS Grid (more on that later) – check out his blog post (and you can also download it from GitHub and try it for yourself).

Wanna see what I've been building? Check out https://t.co/H5PIyyWZvo. #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/o4tagxLPgu

— Calvin (@cjkoepke) May 16, 2017

(And he certainly seems to have made an impact, the reaction to it has been strong).

Just took @cjkoepke's new theme on a test drive. And…..the site is wicked fast! Whoa! #genesiswp #speed #WordPress pic.twitter.com/N1lGo4zNX6

— Bogus Blogging (@BogusBlogging) May 18, 2017

@cjkoepke Reading your newsletter right now. Man, you have a gift! 😍#genesiswp #WordPress pic.twitter.com/EjzKqyyh9J

— Susanta Sahoo (@ugosus) May 18, 2017

Showcase

Peckish Digital for katieedwardsnutrition.com

We're super proud to show off the new site launched for @KEnutrition based on #genesiswp Wellness theme https://t.co/eCYGe0d2lp pic.twitter.com/EaX5eUdMTk

— Peckish Digital (@peckishdigital) May 17, 2017

Omar Al-Ansari for mooyah.ae

Just launched a #genesiswp website for @mooyahuae https://t.co/xQNoDfowO3#WordPress pic.twitter.com/rL56AHhzUA

— Omar Al-Ansari (@oalansari82) May 19, 2017

Matt Whiteley for atozvacuum.com

Latest #genesiswp launch – A to Z Vacuum & Fan. Responsive, clean & WooCommerce ready (phase 2) https://t.co/U1ZrH4XO7l #wordpress

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) May 19, 2017

Podcasts

And if you’re interested in learning more about CSS Grid (see Calvin’s new theme above) you might want to listen to the latest episode of the rethink.fm podcast where host Jackie D’Elia chats to expert Rachel Andrew.

Ready for #CSSGrid? @rachelandrew explains what you need to know. https://t.co/JYLl3Apapj via @rethinkfm

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) May 20, 2017

Best of the rest

Sridhar Katakam shows you how to remove the scripts section from pages using a specific page template in Genesis.

How to remove Scripts section from Pages of a specific Page Template in Genesis:https://t.co/x9J38KKpln#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) May 16, 2017

Chinmoy Paul releases a new paid plugin for connecting Genesis with Beaver Builder and the Themer plugin.

Released the new plugin for #genesiswp and beaver themer. check out the video https://t.co/irS1JWab6f

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) May 16, 2017

If you’ve been following along with Tonya Mork’s announcement of the Profitable WordPress Developer Bootcamp, you’ll likely be pleased to know that Chris Coyier (CSS Tricks, CodePen, the Shop Talk podcast) will be joining the event on 12 – 13 October as well as the after party on the 12th.

I spoke to Toya about the announcment and she told me she’s very excited to have Chris joining what is increasingly looking like a stellar event and I don’t blame her!

[drumroll] @chriscoyier joins the @ProfitableWPDev faculty. Woot! He's coming to help you #MakeMore https://t.co/bPy43phfsJ #WordPress

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) May 17, 2017

💯

Not to get all self indulgent but according to my calculations this is the 100th edition of This Week in Genesis so it seemed appropriate to mark the milestone.

Of course, not all of the editions have been written by me so first of all I have to say a huge thanks to all the guest editors over the last two years.

Finally a huge thanks to everyone who has submitted something to the site and the many of you who take the time to share these updates every week. It is hugely appreciated.

And if you want to make sure you don’t miss the next 100 editions – or however many I manage – you can subscribe below.
